The Glasgow School of Art's Department of Continuing Education offers courses which focus on Fine Art, Design and Architecture. These courses are designed for people who wish to advance their careers, gain personal fulfilment or learn about a new subject for the first time and are for both adults and children.

The Continuing Education Department endeavours to respond to the educational and lifelong learning needs of the local and regional communities. We aim to ensure that the School is a natural point of contact for members of the public seeking to continue their education through the visual arts.

The Department is an integral part of the culture of the School and whatever your previous experience, whether you are a beginner or have been making art for a long time, you will quickly feel part of an exciting and stimulating community.

column4: • Over 1500 students from 7 to 80 study with the Continuing Education Department
• The Department offers children courses in drawing and painting, ceramics, sculpture, fashion and textiles and photography
• Over 85% of students on our Portfolio Preparation classes secure a place on Art & Design Courses across the UK
• Students study in studios within the internationally famous Mackintosh Building - some of the finest studios in the world
• Bursaries are available for Children's Classes and Portfolio Preparation
• Spring Weekend Courses are held throughout March and April
• Continuing Education staff are practicing artists, designers and architects
• Whether you are a beginner or you have been studying or making art for some time, you will quickly feel part of an exciting and stimulating community
• Students exhibit their work at the Annual Continuing Education Exhibition which is open to the public
• Our Continuing Education Courses maintain an honorable tradition in allowing wider community access, whatever your experience
